IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: To serve as a trusted community leader by leveraging resources in support of collaborative solutions.
IRS990.MissionDesc: To serve as a trusted community leader by leveraging resources in support of collaborative solutions.
IRS990.Desc: Youth Success Mentoring: The Middle School Mentoring Program works to enrich the lives of 6th, 7th, and 8th grade middle school students by providing opportunities to build relationships with encouraging, supportive adult mentors These mutually beneficial relationships enable mentors to inspire students to set and strive to reach positive academic and personal goals. PMC: The Pueblo Mentoring Collaborative (PMC) serves as a backbone support for local mentoring programs and other youth serving organizations by addressing gaps in mentoring and providing a system for engaging, supporting, and maintaining quality youth programming. United Way of Pueblo County coordinates these efforts to amplify mentoring and its positive impacts in the Pueblo community.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: Economic Mobility and OpportunityBank On Pueblo County: Bank On Pueblo County is a collaboration between financial institutions, community-based organizations, and local government to ensure that all residents have the opportunity to be financially healthy by improving banking access. Together, we are working to connect people to safe, affordable, and functional certified, banking accounts as a means for improved economic mobility. Our partners also offer services and financial literacy resources that help empower individuals and families to build better, financially stable futures. FEC: The Pueblo Financial Empowerment Center (FEC) is a collaboration between the City of Pueblo, UWPC, and Cities for Financial Empowerment (CFE) Fund to provide individualized financial coaching as a free public service. Services include budgeting/saving for the future, reducing debt/bankruptcy, and understanding credit (establish, build, and repair).VITA: The Pueblo Volunteer Income Tax Assistance (VITA) Program provides free tax preparation and filing for individuals and families with low- to moderate-household incomes. VITA is a program of the IRS, developed more than 50 years ago as a means for income taxpayers to have their tax forms prepared free of charge. IRS-trained volunteers work annually to ensure all taxpayers receive the tax credits and deductions that they are eligible for.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: Crisis InterventionUnited Way of Pueblo County receives various requests for assistance on a regular basis. We offer resources and referrals to connect community member with available services in the community.

ProgSrvcAccomActyOtherGrp.Desc: Nonprofit Capacity DevelopmentBeyond grant dollars, United Way of Pueblo County provides technical assistance, fiscal sponsorships, strategic partnership and additional funding connections, and networking/executive chats.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Organization evaluates the effect of uncertain tax positions, if any, and provides for those positions in accordance with the provisions of FASB ASC 450, Contingencies. No tax accrual for uncertain tax positions has been recorded as management believes there are no uncertain tax positions for the Organization. The Organization has no unrelated business taxable income. Accordingly, no provision for income taxes is made in the financial statements.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: A copy of the Form 990 was provided to the Board of Directors for approval prior to filing.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Organization has a written Conflict of Interest Policy which is signed annually by officers and employees. This policy is monitored and enforced.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Organization has a policy for salary and wage determination to utilize available salary data and information from comparable organizations and for comparable positions to determine salary. Whenever fiscally possible the salary and wage ranges will be comparable to market conditions. Board Members and volunteers are not compensated for their time.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Organization makes governing documents, conflict of interest policy, and financial statements available to the public when requested and an official of the Organization will meet to discuss.
